results.title: The Passion of the Christ
results.creator_credit: ICON, Mel Gibson, Bruce Davey and Stephen McEveety
results.brief_description: Written (with Benedict Fitzgerald), directed and produced by Mel Gibson, “The Passion of the Christ” is the realisation of a very personal project for Gibson. The film deals with the last twelve hours of Jesus of Nazareth’s life opening in the Garden of Gethsemane. Betrayed by the disciple Judas, Jesus (Jim Caviezel) is arrested and stands accused of blasphemy before religious leaders, who insist he should be punished by death. Before the crucifixion however, he is whipped and beaten and the graphic nature of the violence (torturous instruments that remove chunks of flesh shown in slow-motion) may prove too much for some viewers. The film employs the use of brief flashbacks as a vehicle to cover the last supper and life-changing experiences of other important people in his life; namely disciples, his mother Mary and Mary Magdalene. This religious drama uses the original languages of the day as an attempt to add to a more timeless and authentic telling of the story. Production design and cinematography give the film a painterly feel and majestic musical score adds to the emotional intensity, particularly at times when no dialogue is spoken. Cast includes, Maia Morgenstern, Hristo Jivkov, Monica Bellucci, Rosalinda Celentano.

results.title: The Passion of Spain
results.creator_credit: Grainger Maynard, Maynard and Greg Grainger
results.brief_description: As seen on ATN 7 on “The world around us”, this is a tour through Spain, looking at the diverse mix of ancient Spanish traditions and the new vibrancy which has swept through the country. Witness spectacular fairs and parades, as well as looking at the remote areas of the country, such as Galica, the Basque homelands and Gomera in the Canary Islands.

results.title: The Passion of Joan of Arc = The Passion of Jeanne D'Arc
results.creator_credit: Societe Generale Des Films and Carl Theodor Dreyer
results.brief_description: The script was based on original transcripts of the trial of Jeanne d’Arc, period detail was carefully researched, unusually solid sets were constructed and a monumental performance given by Falconetti as Jeanne. However, it is the films formal rigour which places it in the forefront of experimental film art. Cast includes Renee Falconetti, Antonin Artaud, Michel Simon.

results.title: The Passing
results.creator_credit: Bill Viola, TV Lab at WNET/Thirteen and Artists' Television Workshop at WXXI/TV, Rochester
results.material_description: Single channel moving image, black and white and audio
results.brief_description:
Engaged in projects all over the world, Bill Viola has become one of the most celebrated artists working with the moving image. His installations are admired for the lightness with which they address weighty themes: birth, death, the nature of time and impermanence, the mania of individuality contending with the benefits and responsibilities of the human, communal condition. Time and again, Viola organises his installations around dramatic ‘moments of distinction’, like the breath coming in and out of a body distinguishing vitality from mortality, or the blinking eye distinguishing the energy in light from the absence that
is darkness.

In The Passing viewers watch a man - the artist - sleep, and they also witness visions that emerge from his unconscious. As they are bathed in the glow of the dreamer’s imaginary, as they sway to the pulsing of the engulfing soundtrack and feel the dimensions of their own body altering in response to the shifts of scale and variations of weightlessness, they sense a slow but profound shift in their consciousness.

Time passes in an unaccustomed manner, basic emotions like fear and attraction seem to offer themselves for fresh consideration. There is no pre-defined, ‘right’ duration for an encounter with this work. Visitors tend to stay for as long as it takes to feel an alteration; this can be ten seconds, or it can be hours. The Passing might have a beginning, middle and end mapped into its 52-minute linear duration, but the installation is best regarded as an endless loop that circulates like an enormous conceptual mantra, always available for engagement and orientation. No matter where in the timeline a viewer first submerges into The Passing, they will almost instantly find themselves attuned to rhythms and
glimmers that can guide them along their own passage through memory and self-examination to enlightenment.

results.title: The Party's over = The Last party 2000
results.creator_credit: Camoflauge, Dakota Group, Palisades Pictures, Rebecca Chaiklin, Stanley F Buchthal and Donovan
results.brief_description: Philip Seymour Hoffman hosts an exploration of the state of politics in the United States, leading up to the 2000 election. Hoffman collects a variety of perspectives by attending a Farm Aid concert, various rallies, political conventions, a primary school, a NRA gun show, a Christian coalition, and prison towns. By interviewing the young and old, the famous and the obscure, the filmmakers strive to present a multifarious picture of America. Whilst the results are not polished, the work does capture the scandals of the election, including the faulty ballot cards, re-counts and the decision of the Supreme Court to appoint Bush. Interviews include Willie Nelson, Susan Sarandon, Noam Chomsky, and Michael Moore.

results.title: The Party
results.creator_credit: United Artists Corporation, Mirisch Corporation and Blake Edwards
results.brief_description: Blake Edwards and Peter Sellers combine in another comic masterpiece. This time Sellers is not the bumbling Closeau, but the much maligned and accident-prone Indian actor Hrundi V. Bakshi. Hollywood mogul, Fred Clutterbuck is giving the Hollywood party of the century, complete with beautiful women, powerful men and “wanna-be stars.” Blackballed by his producer for wrecking a day’s shooting, Bakshi finds himself unexpectedly invited to the party. Once this walking disaster area enters the festivities, destruction and mayhem follows. A satire on the artifice and snobbery of Tinseltown and a must for lovers of Sellers’ unique comic style. Co-starring Claudine Longet, Marge Champion and Steve Franken with a musical score by Henry Mancini.

results.title: The Party
results.creator_credit: Riverbank Productions, McGraw-Hill Films and Paul Sutherland
results.brief_description: Hammy and Roddy give a party in their home - the well furnished and comfortable interior of an old shoe. After dinner and games the guests leave, Hammy and Roddy relax beofre a fire. Roddy, hearing a srange sound, rushes outside to find Guinea Pig in his flying balloon caught in a tree. They rescue him with a ladder, and a grateful Guinea Pig settles down to enjoy his friends’ hospitality.

results.title: The Parting
results.brief_description: This film, in revealing some of the life and the ritual of death in this village in the Montenegro area of Yugoslavia, promotes examination of our own customs, of our own beliefs, and of those fears and hopes which the recognition of death awakens in each of us.
